page.title: 07BROUGHTY FERRY - ECOLOGY
page.content: {CLIMATE AND WEATHER }Broughty Ferry's situation on the Estuary of the Tay makes it subject to frequent coastal mists and fog, spoiling summer days. Winters are not usually severe, with snow rarely lying for prolonged periods. In the summer, sea breezes keep temperatures lower than inland,so it is rarely very warm. {CONSERVATION }The Parks Department keeps the Parks looking beautiful. Attractive displays on the road verges greatly enhance the area. The Sea Front is particularly attractive especially in the area developed as a rockery. {POLLUTION }Dundee Harbour,with a small oil terminal, is a source of concern regarding pollution. Strict codes of practice have been set and to date the River is in a healthy state.
